DataElement.preferredName: Methylene Blue Dye in Liver Heterogeneous Perfusion Location Specify Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text description of the location of the heterogeneous perfusion of methylene blue dye in the liver.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Methylene Blue Internal Liver Heterogeneity Perfusion
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A synthetic basic dye. Methylene blue stains to negatively charged cell components like nucleic acids; when administered in the lymphatic bed of a tumor during oncologic surgery, methylene blue may stain lymph nodes draining from the tumor, thereby aiding in the visual localization of tumor sentinel lymph nodes. When administered intravenously in low doses, this agent may convert methemoglobin to hemoglobin._Happening or arising or located within some limits, or especially, within some surface._A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate._The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature._The passage of fluid through the vessels of a specific organ or tissue.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A synthetic basic dye. Methylene blue stains to negatively charged cell components like nucleic acids; when administered in the lymphatic bed of a tumor during oncologic surgery, methylene blue may stain lymph nodes draining from the tumor, thereby aiding in the visual localization of tumor sentinel lymph nodes. When administered intravenously in low doses, this agent may convert methemoglobin to hemoglobin.

Concepts.definition: A synthetic basic dye. Methylene blue stains to negatively charged cell components like nucleic acids; when administered in the lymphatic bed of a tumor during oncologic surgery, methylene blue may stain lymph nodes draining from the tumor, thereby aiding in the visual localization of tumor sentinel lymph nodes. When administered intravenously in low doses, this agent may convert methemoglobin to hemoglobin.

Concepts.definition: Happening or arising or located within some limits, or especially, within some surface.

A triangular-shaped organ located under the diaphragm in the right hypochondrium. It is the largest internal organ of the body, weighting up to 2 kg. Metabolism and bile secretion are its main functions. It is composed of cells which have the ability to regenerate.
The quality or state of consisting of elements that are not of the same kind or nature.
The passage of fluid through the vessels of a specific organ or tissue.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.
